## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)
library(patchwork)
```

```{r}
accel_data = read_csv(file = "accel_data/accel_data.csv") %>%
  janitor::clean_names()  %>% 
  mutate(
    weekday_weekend = case_when(
      day ==  "Sunday" ~ "weekend",
       day ==  "Saturday" ~ "weekend",
       day ==  "Monday" ~ "weekday",
        day ==  "Tuesday" ~ "weekday",
         day ==  "Wednesday" ~ "weekday",
          day ==  "Thursday" ~ "weekday",
           day ==  "Friday" ~ "weekday"
           
    )) %>%
  select(., week, day_id, day, weekday_weekend, everything())  %>%
  mutate(., total_activity = rowSums(.[5:1443], na.rm = TRUE)) %>% 
  select(., week, day_id, day, weekday_weekend, total_activity, everything())
```

```{r}
devtools::install_github("p8105/p8105.datasets", force = TRUE)


```

```{r}
library(p8105.datasets)
data("ny_noaa")
```


```{r}
nynoaadat_data = ny_noaa %>%
  janitor::clean_names() %>% 
  separate(., col = date, into = c('year', 'month', 'day')) %>% 
  mutate(., prcp = prcp / 10) %>% 
  mutate(month = as.character(month)) %>% 
  mutate(id = as.character(id),tmax=as.numeric(tmax),tmin=as.numeric(tmin))
  
  
```

```{r}
nynoaadat_data1 = select(nynoaadat_data, id, year, month, tmax) %>% 
  filter(month == "01") %>% 
  drop_na(tmax)
```


```{r}
  pic1=
  nynoaadat_data1 %>%
  group_by(year, id) %>% 
  summarize(
    tmax_mean=mean(tmax)
  )               %>%
  ggplot(aes(x=year,y=tmax_mean))+geom_point(color = "pink") +
  labs(
    title = "Temperature plot",
    x = "year",
    y = "average maximum temperature",
    caption = "Data from RNOAA"
  )
 
```

```{r}
nynoaadat_data2 = select(nynoaadat_data, id, year, month, tmax) %>% 
  filter(month == "07") %>% 
  drop_na(tmax)
```
 
```{r}
 pic2=
  nynoaadat_data1 %>%
  group_by(year, id) %>% 
  summarize(
    tmax_mean=mean(tmax)
  )               %>%
  ggplot(aes(x=year,y=tmax_mean))+geom_point(color = "purple") +
  labs(
    title = "Temperature plot",
    x = "year",
    y = "average maximum temperature",
    caption = "Data from RNOAA"
  )
```
```{r}
pic1 + pic2
```
